description: Dive into "Sun-Kissed Shores of Galle" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Sun-Kissed Shores of Galle

places.generalDescription: Nestled in Unawatuna, Jungle Beach is a serene and secluded stretch of golden sand offering stunning views of Rumassala Hill and the Indian Ocean. This biodiverse beach is home to endemic bird species and various mammals and reptiles. It's an ideal spot for snorkeling or simply unwinding amidst unspoiled surroundings.

sources.snippet: Unawatuna Beach is one of the most famous beaches in Galle that is on the itinerary of every traveller who visits this country. A lot of local people love taking a dip in this beach in noon early evening with their families. This seashore is always teeming with people who find delight in this hypnotic long stretch of coastline with golden sand.

Much less crowded than the more popular Unawatuna Beach, Dalawella is ideal if you‚Äôre looking to kick back and unwind in a stunning setting. Many people come here to take a picture on its now Instagram-famous beach swing.
sources.shortName: Best Things to do in Galle, Sri Lanka (+Photos)

places.name: Jungle Beach, Unawatuna.

reviews.text:
Jungle beach is a must visit place if you're a visitor in Galle!

Interesting adventure, you need to walk down through a jungle footpath to reach the spot.

Stunning view - sunset or sunrise! ü§©

There are few restaurants if you wanna grab some water, juice or snacks, also beach beds are there you need to pay but if you are staying at nearby hotels it can be free if they have the connections.

Waves are very calm, you could enter into the sea without a fear even if you are not a great swimmer.

Enjoy!

Mind your steps when you walk through the footpath!

I really loved my time at Jungle Beach. The little walk through the trees made it feel like I was heading to a secret place. When I got there, it was so quiet and peaceful, just the sound of the waves and birds. The water was calm and great for swimming, and I even saw a few monkeys in the trees! It's not a crowded tourist spot, which made it feel extra special. If you're looking to relax and enjoy a bit of nature, this place is perfect

A hidden gem tucked between lush jungle and calm turquoise waters. Jungle Beach offers a peaceful escape from the busier Unawatuna stretch, with a short scenic walk through nature to reach the shore. The water is perfect for swimming and snorkeling, and the vibe is relaxed and welcoming. Great spot to unwind, enjoy the view, and maybe grab a fresh juice or seafood from the beachside caf√©. Definitely worth the detour if you're looking for serenity and natural beauty

places.generalDescription: Unawatuna Beach is a popular destination for beach holidays, offering a variety of water sports and activities such as snorkeling, scuba diving, and surfing. The area also features attractions like the Japanese Peace Pagoda and nearby beaches like Rumassala, Yatagala Rajamaha Viharaya, Jungle Beach, Mihiripenna Beach, and Dalawella Beach. Visitors can explore turtle hatcheries focused on conservation efforts and may even witness turtles laying eggs along the shoreline.

sources.snippet: You can‚Äôt visit Unawatuna and not visit the beach that is named after it!. Unawatuna Beach is the most popular beach as it has the easiest access from the town.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Beaches in Unawatuna, Sri Lanka (2024)

places.name: Unawatuna Beach

reviews.text: It's the best beach that I have visited in Sri Lanka.There are lots of restaurants and cafes along the main road and the bus stop is less than a minute from the beach. There are palm trees all along the beach,giving it that tropical feeling.

Unawatuna Beach is one of the most beautiful spots in Sri Lanka! The crystal-clear waters, vibrant atmosphere, and top-notch services make it truly unforgettable. Highly recommend the sea diving experience ‚Äì absolutely amazing!

Unawatuna Beach is truly a must-visit destination for both Sri Lankans and foreign travelers alike. The natural beauty of this beach is breathtaking - its distinct curved shoreline and gentle sea waves offer a relaxing, eye-pleasing atmosphere that immediately captures your attention.

We felt we could easily stay here for days without doing anything - it's that visually pleasing and peaceful. Just being by the shore, listening to the waves, and taking in the view is more than enough to make time feel like it's standing still. It's the kind of place that naturally encourages you to slow down and simply enjoy the moment.

For those seeking a bit more activity, boat rides and other water-based experiences are available. These are typically offered by local boat operators, and prices are flexible based on direct negotiation. It's best to discuss your preferences and agree on the details before heading out.

There's a good mix of local vendors, eateries, and accommodations nearby, making it easy to plan a comfortable stay. Whether you're looking for adventure or relaxation, Unawatuna delivers both in its own charming way.

Overall, this is undoubtedly one of the best beaches in Sri Lanka - highly recommended for families, couples, or solo travelers who want to experience nature, comfort, and coastal bliss all in one place.

places.generalDescription: Wijaya Beach Restaurant is a popular spot located just 10 minutes out of town, offering a picturesque waterside dining experience with an array of international seafood and Asian fusion dishes. It's the perfect place to enjoy an ice-cold Lion beer while watching unforgettable sunsets. Situated near Unawatuna, this charming restaurant provides a great view of the ocean and is known for its comfortable ambiance. The menu offers delicious options, including outstanding cheesecake.

sources.snippet: Wijaya Beach is one of the more popular beaches for tourists and is actually named after the beachfront bar and restaurant, located on Dalawella Beach.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Beaches in Unawatuna, Sri Lanka (2024)

places.name: Wijaya Beach Restaurant

reviews.text:
Wijaya Beach Restaurant is a must-visit spot down south! The view is absolutely stunning - right by the ocean with a chill, tropical vibe. We even saw sea turtles from the beach, and the owner was so kind and helpful, allowing us to access the nearby turtle beach through the restaurant.

The food was fantastic too - the smoked chicken pizza had a unique and delicious flavor, definitely a must-try. Their fresh tropical juices were super refreshing and full of flavor. Great place for relaxing, enjoying good food, and experiencing warm, local hospitality. Highly recommend!

After a day of swimming and turtle spotting, we went to Wijaya Beach Restaurant. The staff were very kind and friendly, and we got a table with a beautiful sea view.

The service was quick, and the staff were especially lovely with our young children. The pizza from their special oven was delicious, and the shrimp mango curry was absolutely amazing. We enjoyed it so much that we returned for a second visit. The food was excellent, and the upstairs area offers the best view.

Had dinner at this beachfront restaurant. Not much beach though. Mostly rocks and a small strip of sand really.  Dog friendly‚ù§Ô∏èI took my little doggoe and kids. Nice staff. Yum food! Reasonable prices. Payment having to be settled at the counter directly instead of being brought to the table was a bit weird. Had to traverse two floors up and down just to settle the bill. despite that little oddity I really liked this place and the vibe.

places.generalDescription: The Postcard Galle is a luxurious resort hotel located in Galle, Sri Lanka. It features beautiful accommodation with a restaurant and views of the sea. The hotel also offers private parking and a bar. It is perfect for those looking to enjoy all that Galle has to offer, including its famous cricket match atmosphere.

sources.snippet: Did you know there are a large number of boutique hotels strewn across Sri Lanka?. Most of them set up in a beautiful and large colonial villa or house. The Postcard near Galle is the perfect place for those looking to discover the history of Galle while also enjoying the quiet beach nearby.
sources.shortName: Best beaches to visit near Galle + where to stay (2021 update)

places.name: The Postcard Galle, Sri Lanka

reviews.text:
A really lovely boutique hotel. The staff are amazing, so courteous and helpful. Bharat, the manager was excellent, as were Arshad, Vikim, Sandaruwan & Nirmal.
We really enjoyed the anytime breakfast and it was delicious. We had lunch several times and dinner, both very good. Great pool, beautiful grounds and wonderful views of the coast.
It's a little outside Galle, but easy to get a tuktuk.
The room was large, bed had mosquito nets. Could benefit from a fridge. Room 2 does not have a window you can see out of.

We had a lovely and relaxing experience here. The place is tastefully decorated, with no loud noises, just a peaceful atmosphere. It's definitely one of the best spots to watch the sunset. The welcoming vibe and friendly service really stood out.
Had an amazing stay at The Postcard. The room was nice and spacious, staff were lovely and attentive. The food was fantastic. So pleased we stayed there for a few nights!

places.address: 607, 10 Old Colombo Main Rd, Galle 80280, Sri Lanka

places.generalDescription: Dewata Beach, located in the Galle area of Sri Lanka, offers a unique surfing experience suitable for beginners and experts alike. The beach is surrounded by numerous surfing schools that provide training for those looking to catch some waves. The crystal-clear waters are perfect for swimming, while the soft sand invites visitors to relax and sunbathe. Shaded areas offer respite from the sun's rays.

sources.snippet: This is the busiest beach so far, with bars pumping reggae music, selling food and offering surfboards for rent. It‚Äôs the closest one to Galle Fort with all of the amenities you need to enjoy the whole day at the beach, but there are a few drawbacks. If you don‚Äôt want to surf, drink or eat at Dewata, you‚Äôll find it difficult to avoid being targeted by all of the bar staff along the sand.

Experience surfing like nowhere else on Dewata Beach, where even beginners can try their balance on the surfboards. The waves are high enough to give you the surfing experience, but low enough to let you practice with ease. The area around this bay is surrounded by many surfing schools who would train you well that you can go surfing on any one of the beaches in Galle.

places.name: Dewata Beach

reviews.text: Dewata beach is one of the most picturesque beaches in the Southern coast of Sri Lanka located about 3km from Galle town.It is one of the best beaches for surfing especially for beginners
This is my hometown. The beach is very clean compare to the pther down south beaches. Very limited space, but fantastic for surfers. Anyone can go have a walkon the beach unlike other places.

It's a nice place for an evening walk or to buy fish. You can watch the sunset at the horizon.
You'd see the mountain Ruumassala to the left.
On the other side of the road. Sunset view is breathtaking. ü§©

places.generalDescription: Jungle Beach, located at the opposite end of Unawatuna Beach, is a compact sand beach that offers a secluded escape from the city bustle. It is popular for swimming and sunbathing, with the option to enjoy snorkeling and scuba diving amidst sparkling coral reefs and schools of fish. Visitors can trek to the beach or opt for a boat ride to reach its verdant stretches.

sources.snippet: Seclusion, clear waters, active marine life and surreal splendour is everything that you will witness when you visit the Jungle Beach. Since it is set off a little away from the other beaches, you might be able to evade the regular crowd and might probably see just a few who themselves are there for some quiet time. One needs to make a small trek through the jungle to reach this beach; do not stop when you reach the bay, walk further ahead to find a lonely bay with hardly any people.

Jungle Beach has got plenty of amazing reviews and it is easy to see why!. There is a parking area at the top of the path that takes you to the beach. It cost us 100 rupees to park our tuk tuk there all day and it‚Äôs the same for bikes.

Jungle Beach in Unawatuna is one of the most secluded beaches on the southern coast of the island. With stretches of golden yellow sand and bright blue water, the beach looks like something from a movie.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Beaches in Unawatuna, Sri Lanka (2024)

places.name: Jungle Beach

reviews.text:
Nice beach! Short walk to access from the parking area but very nice beach, with some activities and a restaurant to enjoy seafood, quick food or a drink! Nice!
And you might see some monkeys! :)

Jungle Beach is a beautiful little gem. The white sand and cool blue sea create a picture-perfect setting. The beach looked clean - no visible rubbish on the shore - though while swimming, we did feel the odd bit of debris like a plastic bag in the water. Nothing major, just the occasional reminder.

The water was calm and inviting, and while there are some stoney parts on the seabed, it didn't take away from the fun. Just something to be aware of when wading in.

Sunbeds are well maintained, with padded mats for added comfort - a nice touch that made lounging even more relaxing. They're ‚Äúfree‚Äù as long as you buy something from the restaurant supplying them. We had two fruit juices and two king coconuts over our five-hour stay, totalling 2500 LKR. The staff were polite, helpful, and never pushy - service was quick and friendly.

The atmosphere was lovely and peaceful - not overcrowded at all. Just people relaxing, enjoying the sun, and having fun in the calm, clear water.

The walk to the beach is mostly downhill and can be a bit steep in places, especially in the second half, where there are steps to guide you down. Take it slow and steady - it's more than doable and definitely worth the effort.

At the start of the trail, there are locals offering parking. We paid 100 LKR for each of our bikes, which felt fair and gave us peace of mind knowing they were in a safe spot.

All in all, it is a perfect spot for a relaxing day by the sea.

Jungle Beach is a truly beautiful and serene location that absolutely deserves its place as a popular tourist attraction. Nestled between lush greenery and the ocean, the setting is calm and peaceful, offering a relaxing escape from the busy city life.

Despite its quiet atmosphere, the beach often attracts a fair number of visitors, especially during peak times. The shoreline is shallow, making it suitable for light swimming, though caution is always advised. Lifeguards are usually present, but it's wise to check before entering the water.

Access to the beach involves a short walk of approximately 200 meters through a slightly rugged but enjoyable trail, adding to the adventure and charm of the visit. Jungle Beach is ideal for those who love a mix of natural beauty, calm vibes, and a touch of exploration.

Highly recommended for nature lovers and anyone looking for a peaceful beach experience.

sources.snippet: This is also referred to as Siyambalagahawatta Beach on Google Maps, but we asked a local restaurant owner and he just said it was called Galle City Beach!. Either way, it‚Äôs a lovely stretch of sand with a few small restaurants hidden underneath the trees. There are toilets in the restaurant across the road but none on the actual beach, so consider that if you‚Äôre planning to spend all day here!

reviews.text: Galle Fort Beach is pretty cool! The old fort walls are super interesting, and the beach itself is chill. It's not the best for swimming, but it's perfect for a sunset stroll or grabbing a bite at one of the nearby cafes. Definitely worth a visit!

Galle Fort Beach is a calm and serene spot located inside the historic Galle Fort. the beach offers a peaceful atmosphere with gentle waves and soft sands, making it safe for swimming and ideal for kids. The area is less crowded, allowing for quiet walks and stunning sunset views. Safety, beauty, and close proximity to shops and cafes, it's a true hidden gem.
Cool little beach. Fun for all. Very cooling.

sources.snippet: The first references of Galle port comes during King Solomons times which is believed to be ‚ÄúTarish‚Äù in the Bible, and cinnamon has been the main export of Sri Lanka starting around 1400 years BC. Southern port of call for many ancient silk route bound ships, the Galle harbour or then known as ‚ÄúGimhathitha‚Äù but the ancient mariner Ibn Battuta referes to it as ‚ÄúQali‚Äù is located 119 kilometers from Colombo. The town reached its peak during the Dutch colonial period remnants‚Äô of it lies today in the form of the UNESCO world heritage site of Galle Fort, which is also acclaimed as the largest remaining fortification in Asia, fortified by every European nation that set foot on the Island such was the importance of this port to their spice trade.

reviews.text:
Galle Beach, located along the southern coast of Sri Lanka near the historic city of Galle, is known for its scenic beauty, golden sands, and calm waters. It is a peaceful and less crowded beach compared to some of the more commercialized beaches in the region, making it ideal for relaxing, swimming, and enjoying the coastal atmosphere.

Nearby attractions include the Galle Dutch Fort, which adds historical charm to the beach experience. The coastline offers stunning views, especially during sunrise and sunset, and you can often spot fishermen, small boats, and locals enjoying the sea breeze. Some sections of the beach are also great for snorkeling and exploring marine life.

Though Galle Beach itself is relatively quiet, popular nearby beaches like Unawatuna, Jungle Beach, and Dalawella are just a short drive away, offering more activities such as surfing, diving, and beachside dining.

Great beach for swimming
A little rubbish on the beach, but the water is clear and warm

places.generalDescription: Mihiripenna Beach, also known as Jungle Beach, is a hidden gem nestled between Unawatuna and Thalpe in Sri Lanka. This tranquil beach offers soft golden sands, clear turquoise waters, and a backdrop of lush greenery and coconut palms. Nearby attractions include Rumassala, Yatagala Rajamaha Viharaya, Unawatuna beach, the Jungle beach, and Dalawella beach.

sources.snippet: The beach is regarded as one of Sri Lanka‚Äôs best swim spots and if you have a snorkel and mask, you‚Äôll have an opportunity to see a huge range of fish and other marine life. It‚Äôs a very safe area for swimming, making it popular with families.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Beaches in Unawatuna, Sri Lanka (2024)

places.name: Mihiripenna Beach

reviews.text: Safe, clean & cool place to bath. You can watch turtles & get bath experience with little fish species. Amazing view and major reason of safety is the barrier rock. Many local & foriegn tourists visit this place and safety will be the main reason behind that.

Nice and safe place

Update 2025: Came back recently and wow Mihiripenna Beach is even more beautiful now! The waters are calm and clear, and it's full of sea turtles. Peaceful, clean, and perfect for a relaxing swim or turtle spotting!

One of the very safe beaches to bathe in Sri Lanka. There is a sea pool without waves and deep areas. This beach is narrow and there are hotels and restaurants along the beach. Usually, You can see turtles around there. snorkeling equipment is available there and you can see coral reefs and turtles. Mihiripanna beach has been crowded with tourists these days.

places.generalDescription: Lighthouse Beach, situated on the eastern side of Galle Fort, offers a picturesque setting with its soft sandy shore and gentle waves. The beach is safe for children due to its shallow waters and natural rock formations that protect it from rough waves. Visitors can enjoy unobstructed views of the Indian Ocean and engage in water activities such as swimming, scuba diving, and surfing. Despite some debris along the coral beach, the area provides a unique experience with friendly dogs playing amidst the scenic surroundings.

sources.snippet: We were surprised to find that Lighthouse Beach, Galle Fort Beach, and Galle Fort Swimming Bach are essentially all the same place!. The beach sits on the corner of the famous lighthouse. There is a large area that is cordoned off where you can and should specifically swim ‚Äì but the actual sandy parts are all the same.

places.name: Lighthouse Beach

reviews.text:
Galle Lighthouse Beach is a captivating destination that offers a unique blend of historical charm and natural beauty. Located within the historic Galle Fort in Sri Lanka, this beach is not only known for its scenic appeal but also for its rich history.

The lighthouse itself, built in 1939, stands as a striking landmark overlooking the beach. It adds a historic touch to the picturesque landscape and provides a fascinating backdrop for photos. The lighthouse is an integral part of the Galle Fort's heritage, reflecting the colonial past of the area when the fort was an important trading post.

The beach at Galle Lighthouse is serene and relatively quiet, making it an excellent spot for a relaxing stroll or a peaceful day by the sea. The coastline is lined with palm trees and offers stunning views of the Indian Ocean. The presence of the lighthouse adds a unique charm and historical significance to the area, making it a great place for history enthusiasts and travelers alike.

Visitors can explore the nearby Galle Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, which adds another layer of historical context to the visit. The fort's walls, colonial architecture, and the lighthouse provide a glimpse into Sri Lanka's maritime history.

Overall, Galle Lighthouse Beach combines natural beauty with historical significance, making it a must-visit destination for anyone traveling to Galle. The blend of scenic views, historical landmarks, and the peaceful beach atmosphere creates a memorable and enriching experience.

We had stayed close by to this place and so we woke up early to enjoy the beach..

We were the only ones early morning at 5.30 am just enough light before the sun rise and capture it.

The beach is a coral beach and so we need to be careful when walking. A lot of debris and trash too here and there but other than that it was awesome beach.

We found three dogs to greet us and later they were busy playing and catching crabs.

Later I got so tempted that I decided to have a swim. The water was warm and the decision to get in the water was the best one. The water is shallow  and safe and anyone can even waddle till waist deep.

Lovely sunrise . Listening to the waves was meditation for me

A beautiful beach with plenty of shade. Also, suitable for swimming. However, to be on the safe side, do as the locals do.
Sadly, it's full of plastic brought ashore by the ocean, but also cans and glass bottles thrown away by visitors. Please stop polluting OUR world.

places.generalDescription: Dalawella Beach is a picturesque spot in Sri Lanka that has gained popularity on Instagram thanks to its iconic palm tree swings. This beach is a must-visit for travelers looking to capture stunning photos and keep up with the latest travel trends. Located near other attractions like Rumassala, Yatagala Rajamaha Viharaya, Unawatuna beach, and the Jungle beach, Dalawella Beach offers visitors the chance to witness sea turtles laying eggs along the shoreline.

sources.snippet: Wijaya Beach is one of the more popular beaches for tourists and is actually named after the beachfront bar and restaurant, located on Dalawella Beach.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Beaches in Unawatuna, Sri Lanka (2024)

places.name: Dalawella Beach

reviews.text: It's one of the most scenic beaches in Sri Lanka with amazing views! This place is not too crowded and perfect for a swim/bath.

One of the most beautiful beaches in the Ahangama area, and probably the second best beach in Sri Lanka that I have been to. The fact that you can meet and see beautiful turtles at random times around the beach is an amazing bonus

Dalawella Beach is a great place for swimming and watching turtles. We've seen 6+ turtles most of the time when we are visiting. The sea is very calm in this place, and you can swim with the kids. If you have snorkels, you can watch beautiful fish around the rocks as well.

places.generalDescription: The Beach of Bonavista in Galle is a popular spot for surfing, with adaptable waves that offer a thrilling experience. It's also great for leisurely walks and exploring the sandy shores. Families can enjoy building sand castles and digging holes in the spacious area. Nearby accommodations provide convenient access to this beautiful beach, which is known for its stunning sunset views. Additionally, it's a family-friendly destination during the monsoon season, offering opportunities for both surfing and swimming.

sources.snippet: Beach of Bonavista is among the surfing beaches in Galle where you can revel in the thrill of surfing on the challenging yet adaptable waves that hit this shore. Walk around on this beach and explore the best of Sri Lankan sand. Children who visit this beach have a memorable time building sand castles and digging holes as there is enough space to do so.
Galle beach between Thalpe next to Unawatuna Bay in the west and Weligama to the east. Of course Unawatuna is a beach at Galle too. It is in fact a suburb of Galle but is best treated separately.

places.name: Beach of Bonavista

reviews.text: It's a beautiful beach at Galle.
Nice place to relax and see amazing sunset

Perfect place for surfing üèÑ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

Surfing board is around Rs.500 per hour (depending on the demand) and you can hire a personal coach also at a reasonable price.

Crowd is really friendly and nice to be around.

There are lots of foreigners in the beach and 80%+ of the surfers are foreigners.

If you're new, don't worry. You can have a personal trainer for one hour and they'll guide you.

Personal trainer will guide you from the  basics to pro mode.

You don't need to worry if you don't know how to swim as the shallow is there for about 100m+.

The view is stunning and the foods are delicious..

There are several places to buy foods and cost will depend on the restaurant.

There's a photographer called Gayan Anushka and you can ask him to capture while you're riding waves.üåä

Enjoy your ride!‚ù§Ô∏è
